info.title: Scheduler0
info.description:
REST API documentation for the Scheduler0 http server

## Authentication Methods

### 1. API Key + Secret Authentication (Default)
Most endpoints require API Key and Secret authentication:
- `X-API-Key`: Your API key
- `X-Secret-Key`: Your API secret
- `X-Account-ID`: Your account ID (required for most endpoints)

### 2. Basic Authentication (Peer Communication)
Peer-to-peer communication uses Basic Authentication:
- Username and password from scheduler0 configuration
- `X-Peer` header with value 'cmd' or 'peer'

### 3. No Authentication
- `/api/v1/healthcheck` - Health check endpoint

## Account ID Requirements

The following endpoints require the `X-Account-ID` header:
- `/api/v1/jobs/*`
- `/api/v1/projects/*`
- `/api/v1/credentials/*`
- `/api/v1/executors/*`
- `/api/v1/async-tasks/*`
- `/api/v1/executions`

Account endpoints (`/api/v1/accounts/*`) and features (`/api/v1/features`) do not require account ID.

tags.name: Accounts
tags.description: Accounts are the main entities that own projects, jobs, and other resources

tags.name: Credentials
tags.description: Credentials are used to authenticate client applications / sdk that want to access scheduler0 api

tags.name: Jobs
tags.description: Jobs are the scheduled tasks that are executed by scheduler0

tags.name: Projects
tags.description: Projects are a collections of jobs

tags.name: Executors
tags.description: Executors are the different types of executors that can be used to execute jobs

tags.name: Features
tags.description: Features are capabilities that can be enabled for accounts

tags.name: AsyncTasks
tags.description: AsyncTasks are tasks that are executed asynchronously

get.description: Returns execution logs for jobs within a specified date range. Requires startDate and endDate parameters in RFC3339 format. Optionally filter by projectId and jobId.

200.description: a collection of all the stats for jobs executed

get.description: Returns current leader and raft stats. No authentication required.

data.description: Data related to the current Raft cluster state.

leaderAddress.description: Address of the current Raft leader.

leaderId.description: ID of the current Raft leader.

raftStats.description: Detailed statistics about the Raft state machine.

applied_index.description: Index of the last log entry applied to the state machine.

commit_index.description: Index of the highest log entry known to be committed.

fsm_pending.description: Number of log entries pending application to the FSM.

last_contact.description: Time since last contact with leader, in milliseconds.

last_log_index.description: Index of the last log entry stored.

last_log_term.description: Term of the last log entry stored.

last_snapshot_index.description: Index of the last snapshot taken.

last_snapshot_term.description: Term of the last snapshot taken.

latest_configuration_index.description: Index at which the latest configuration was committed.

num_peers.description: Number of peers in the Raft cluster.

state.description: Current Raft node state (e.g., Leader, Follower).

term.description: Current term of the Raft node.

success.description: Indicates if the healthcheck was successful.

get.description: Retrieves an async task by request ID. If the task is not completed, this endpoint will block until the task finishes or the request times out. Returns the task immediately if already completed.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Request ID of the async task

accountId.name: x-account-id
accountId.description: The account ID for the request

limit.name: limit
limit.description: Maximum number of items to return

features.description: List of features enabled for this account

dateCreated.description: Date when the account was created

dateModified.description: Date when the account was last modified

name.description: Name of the account to create
